abstract: SAC settles insider trading cases for $616 million. | Senate inquiry faults JPMorgan on trading loss. | Fed faults two big banks over plans for capital. | At hearing, nominee for S.E.C. chief vows to be a tough Wall St. regulator. | Andrew Ross Sorkin on the realities behind prosecuting big banks.

lead_paragraph: SAC settles insider trading cases for $616 million. | Senate inquiry faults JPMorgan on trading loss. | Fed faults two big banks over plans for capital. | At hearing, nominee for S.E.C. chief vows to be a tough Wall St. regulator. | Andrew Ross Sorkin on the realities behind prosecuting big banks.

headline.main: Week in Review: A Rebuke for the Absent C.E.O.
